definitions.definition: The dominion of an Elector in the Holy Roman Empire.
The collective people of a country, state, or electoral district who are entitled to vote.
definitions.example: The votes have been counted and the electorate has spoken.

definitions.definition: The geographic area encompassing an electoral district.
definitions.example: The electorate of Finchley borders on the electorate of Much-Binding-in-the-Marsh, splitting the new housing estate of Royal Cupolas.
